instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.SYS_ONEWIRE: What is SYS_ONEWIRE? This is a bidirectional communication line between the system management controller(SMC) and the charger that allows the charger to communicate with the SMC. This must be working for the light to come on on the magsafe charger. .
definitions.R7005: What is R7005? resistor between charger and CHGR_DCIN pin of ISL6259, if CHGR_DCIN is low then this resistor is probably blown. When PPBUS_G3H is low or missing this is something to check if your model has CHGR_DCIN along R7005. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> CPU vcore present / light & fan / no boot
threads.message:
MacBook had liquid damage, fan spun with MagSafe. Replaced corroded J9500 to get <SIGNAL>SYS_ONEWIRE</SIGNAL> and light back. 
Fan spins up to high immediately only on power supply or magsafe but doesn't actually turn on. CPU VCORE is present and CPU gets warm. 
No boot in min config either. 

Slight corrosion on GND points between <RESISTOR>R5193</RESISTOR> & <CAPACITOR>C5602</CAPACITOR>. Cleaned area, including under SMC (no reball).

Should I be looking at bad CPU/SMC or junk under? Something else obvious that I'm missing..?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> CPU vcore present / light & fan / no boot
threads.message: Does it power on and stay on? Not do on-off-on? USB mouse lighting up? SMC heated with flux?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> CPU vcore present / light & fan / no boot
threads.message:
Getting back to this board.. I'm getting a green light then amber, no fan. Check <RESISTOR>R7006</RESISTOR> for V and immediately get fan spin for 12 seconds on, off, 12 seconds on, off - USB mouse light on the whole time until i remove probes. Same with <RESISTOR>R7005</RESISTOR>. Same with meter off. 
Hit the SMC with some heat/ flux. Power supply and 3 different chargers, known good DC-in and cable.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> CPU vcore present / light & fan / no boot
threads.message: <RESISTOR>R7005</RESISTOR> is on PPBUS feeding 3V42 circuit. I see no reason why the board would power on when touching this. I also see no reason to measure anything there as green/orange light is present so 3V42 must be present. <RESISTOR>R7006</RESISTOR> is not in the schematic. Check what you are measuring.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> CPU vcore present / light & fan / no boot
threads.message:
No Title

See image for <RESISTOR>R7006</RESISTOR>. 
I've had this resistor be the issue with a lot of MBA's. Some even with the light. I always start there to see what I'm getting...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> CPU vcore present / light & fan / no boot
threads.message: Oops, I was looking at the 3476 schematic. Still no idea why it would power on when touching that. Is 3V42 present and stable? Crap under the SMC is still suspect.
